text: 9The national court considers that although according to the case-law of the Court (judgment in Case 155/84 Onnasch v Hauptzollamt Berlin-Packhof [1985] ECR 1449) the expression original sculptures and statuary, in any material under Heading 9703 is to be interpreted widely so as to embrace all three-dimensional artistic productions irrespective of the techniques and the materials used, it is doubtful whether the work in question may be classified under that heading. It suggests that although it is a three-dimensional object, the actual artistic production consists of a design on the surface of a steel plate.
